pageContext.claim: “In 2018, hyperinflation in Venezuela exceeded 1 million percent.”
pageContext.analysis: The International Monetary Fund estimates inflation in Venezuela reached 1.37 million percent in 2018. But not all scholars agree with that assessment. Steve Hanke, who teaches applied economics at Johns Hopkins, estimated the inflation was closer to 80,000%. Either way, as The Post reported in 2017, “Venezuela hasn't released official inflation data since 2015,” so it’s tough to know the exact percent of Venezuela’s very high inflation.
